the content of stderr when the script exits with an error.

declarations.name: drag
declarations.description: Begins listening for dragging.

Attaches the necessary events to make an element draggable.

This by itself will not make the element draggable, but it provides the events and callbacks necessary to facilitate
dragging. Use the `clientX` and `clientY` arguments of each callback to update the UI as desired when dragging.

Drag functionality will be enabled as soon as the constructor is called. A `start()` and `stop()` method can be used
to start and stop it, if needed.
declarations.name: DraggableElement

members.name: options
members.default: { start: () => undefined, stop: () => undefined, move: () => undefined, ...options, }

members.name: start
members.description: Start listening to drags.

members.name: stop
members.description: Stop listening to drags.

members.name: toggle
members.description: Starts or stops the drag listeners.

declarations.name: waitForEvent
declarations.description: Waits for a specific event to be emitted from an element. Ignores events that bubble up from child elements.

declarations.name: getText

parameters.name: root
parameters.description: One or more nodes to get text content from.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description:
By default, will just return element.textContent for any child elements instead of calling the function recursively.
  Set to a positive integer to recurse that many levels. Generally a tradeoff between performance and accuracy.

declarations.description:
Like textContent, but better:
- Uses assignedNodes to get text content from slots (and falls back to content if nothing is slotted)
- Ignores script and style elements

declarations.name: clamp
declarations.description: Ensures a number stays within a minimum and maximum value

declarations.name: getOffset
declarations.description:
Returns an element's offset relative to its parent. Similar to element.offsetTop and element.offsetLeft, except the
parent doesn't have to be positioned relative or absolute.

NOTE: This was created to work around what appears to be a bug in Chrome where a slotted element's offsetParent seems
to ignore elements inside the surrounding shadow DOM: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=920069

declarations.name: parseSpaceDelimitedTokens
declarations.description: Parses a space-delimited set of tokens and returns an array with all whitespace removed.

declarations.name: lockBodyScrolling
declarations.description:
Prevents body scrolling. Keeps track of which elements requested a lock so multiple levels of locking are possible
without premature unlocking.

declarations.name: unlockBodyScrolling
declarations.description: Unlocks body scrolling. Scrolling will only be unlocked once all elements that requested a lock call this method.

declarations.name: scrollIntoView
declarations.description: Scrolls an element into view of its container. If the element is already in view, nothing will happen.

Given a list of nodes, this function iterates over all of them and returns the concatenated
HTML as a string. This is useful for getting the HTML that corresponds to a slots assigned nodes (since we can't use slot.innerHTML as an alternative).

members.name: css
members.description:
One or more CSS files to include in the component's shadow root. Host styles are automatically prepended. We use
this instead of Lit's styles property because we're importing CSS files as strings and need to convert them using
unsafeCSS.

members.name: styles
members.description:
Override the default styles property to fetch and convert string CSS files. Components can override this behavior
by setting their own `static styles = []` property.

members.name: customStates
members.default: { /** Adds or removes the specified custom state. */ set: (customState: string, active: boolean) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return; if (active) { this.internals.states.add(customState); } else { this.internals.states.delete(customState); } }, /** Determines whether or not the element currently has the specified state. */ has: (customState: string) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return false; return this.internals.states.has(customState); }, }
members.description: Methods for setting and checking custom states.

members.name: relayNativeEvent
members.description:
Given a native event, this function cancels it and dispatches it again from the host element using the desired
event options.

members.name: validators
members.description:
Validators are static because they have `observedAttributes`, essentially attributes to "watch"
for changes. Whenever these attributes change, we want to be notified and update the validator.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the input, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the form control.

members.name: validationTarget
members.description: Override this to change where constraint validation popups are anchored.

members.name: setCustomValidity
members.description:
Do not use this when creating a "Validator". This is intended for end users of components.
We track manually defined custom errors so we don't clear them on accident in our validators.

members.name: formStateRestoreCallback
members.description:
Called when the browser is trying to restore elements state to state in which case reason is "restore", or when
the browser is trying to fulfill autofill on behalf of user in which case reason is "autocomplete". In the case of
"restore", state is a string, File, or FormData object previously set as the second argument to setFormValue.

members.name: resetValidity
members.description: Reset validity is a way of removing manual custom errors and native validation.

declarations.name: startLoader
declarations.description: Starts the autoloader.

declarations.name: stopLoader
declarations.description: Stops the autoloader

declarations.name: discover
declarations.description: Checks a node for undefined elements and attempts to register them.

declarations.name: preventTurboFouce
declarations.description:
Acts as a middleware for Turbo's `turbo:before-render` event to ensure components are auto-loaded before showing the
next page, eliminating page-to-page FOUCE in a Turbo environment.

declarations.name: setBasePath
declarations.description: Sets the library's base path to the specified directory or URL.

declarations.name: getBasePath

parameters.name: subpath
parameters.description: An optional path to append to the base path.

declarations.description:
Gets the library's base path.

The base path is used to load assets such as icons and images, so it needs to be set for components to work properly.
By default, this script will look for a script ending in webawesome.js or webawesome.loader.js and set the base path
to the directory that contains that file. To override this behavior, you can add the data-webawesome attribute to any
element on the page to point to a local path or a CORS-enabled endpoint, such as a CDN.

  <script src="bundle.js" data-webawesome="/custom/base/path"></script>

Alternatively, you can set the base path manually using the exported setBasePath() function.

declarations.name: setKitCode
declarations.description: Sets the library's Web Awesome kit code.

declarations.name: getKitCode
declarations.description:
Gets the library's Web Awesome kit code.

The kit code is used to fetch premium assets, so it needs to be set for certain components to work correctly. This
isn't something we can infer, so the user will need to provide it using the `data-fa-kit-code` attribute. This can
be on any element, but ideally it should exist on the script that imports Web Awesome.

  <script src="bundle.js" data-fa-kit-code="abc123"></script>

Alternatively, you can set the kit code manually using the exported `setKitCode()` function.

declarations.name: allDefined
declarations.description:
Waits for custom elements that are currently on the page to be registered before resolving. This is sugar for
awaiting `customElements.whenDefined()` multiple times. By default, the function waits for all undefined Web Awesome
elements, but you can pass a custom match function to wait for other custom elements instead.

The function returns with `Promise.all()`, so any loading errors will cause it to reject. Make sure you handle errors
accordingly using a try/catch block or a `.catch()`.

declarations.name: serialize
declarations.description:
Serializes a form and returns a plain object. If a form control with the same name appears more than once, the
property will be converted to an array.

declarations.name: WaAnimation

slots.description: The element to animate. Avoid slotting in more than one element, as subsequent ones will be ignored. To animate multiple elements, either wrap them in a single container or use multiple `<wa-animation>` elements.

members.name: css
members.description:
One or more CSS files to include in the component's shadow root. Host styles are automatically prepended. We use
this instead of Lit's styles property because we're importing CSS files as strings and need to convert them using
unsafeCSS.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the built-in animation to use. For custom animations, use the `keyframes` prop.

members.name: play
members.description:
Plays the animation. When omitted, the animation will be paused. This attribute will be automatically removed when
the animation finishes or gets canceled.

members.name: delay
members.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

members.name: direction
members.description:
Determines the direction of playback as well as the behavior when reaching the end of an iteration.
[Learn more](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-direction)

members.name: duration
members.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.

members.name: easing
members.description:
The easing function to use for the animation. This can be a Web Awesome easing function or a custom easing function
such as `cubic-bezier(0, 1, .76, 1.14)`.

members.name: endDelay
members.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the active period of an animation sequence.

members.name: fill
members.description: Sets how the animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

members.name: iterations
members.description: The number of iterations to run before the animation completes. Defaults to `Infinity`, which loops.

members.name: iterationStart
members.description: The offset at which to start the animation, usually between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

members.name: keyframes
members.description: The keyframes to use for the animation. If this is set, `name` will be ignored.

members.name: playbackRate
members.description:
Sets the animation's playback rate. The default is `1`, which plays the animation at a normal speed. Setting this
to `2`, for example, will double the animation's speed. A negative value can be used to reverse the animation. This
value can be changed without causing the animation to restart.

members.name: currentTime
members.description: Gets and sets the current animation time.

members.name: cancel
members.description: Clears all keyframe effects caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

members.name: finish
members.description: Sets the playback time to the end of the animation corresponding to the current playback direction.

members.name: styles
members.description:
Override the default styles property to fetch and convert string CSS files. Components can override this behavior
by setting their own `static styles = []` property.

members.name: customStates
members.default: { /** Adds or removes the specified custom state. */ set: (customState: string, active: boolean) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return; if (active) { this.internals.states.add(customState); } else { this.internals.states.delete(customState); } }, /** Determines whether or not the element currently has the specified state. */ has: (customState: string) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return false; return this.internals.states.has(customState); }, }
members.description: Methods for setting and checking custom states.

members.name: relayNativeEvent
members.description:
Given a native event, this function cancels it and dispatches it again from the host element using the desired
event options.

members.name: css
members.description:
One or more CSS files to include in the component's shadow root. Host styles are automatically prepended. We use
this instead of Lit's styles property because we're importing CSS files as strings and need to convert them using
unsafeCSS.

members.name: validators
members.description:
Validators are static because they have `observedAttributes`, essentially attributes to "watch"
for changes. Whenever these attributes change, we want to be notified and update the validator.

members.name: variant
members.description: The button's theme variant. Defaults to `neutral` if not within another element with a variant.

members.name: appearance
members.description: The button's visual appearance.

members.name: size
members.description: The button's size.

members.name: withCaret
members.description: Draws the button with a caret. Used to indicate that the button triggers a dropdown menu or similar behavior.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the button. Does not apply to link buttons.

members.name: loading
members.description: Draws the button in a loading state.

members.name: pill
members.description: Draws a pill-style button with rounded edges.

members.name: type
members.description:
The type of button. Note that the default value is `button` instead of `submit`, which is opposite of how native
`<button>` elements behave. When the type is `submit`, the button will submit the surrounding form.

members.name: name
members.description:
The name of the button, submitted as a name/value pair with form data, but only when this button is the submitter.
This attribute is ignored when `href` is present.

members.name: value
members.description:
The value of the button, submitted as a pair with the button's name as part of the form data, but only when this
button is the submitter. This attribute is ignored when `href` is present.

members.name: href
members.description: When set, the underlying button will be rendered as an `<a>` with this `href` instead of a `<button>`.

members.name: target
members.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is present.

members.name: rel
members.description: When using `href`, this attribute will map to the underlying link's `rel` attribute.

members.name: download
members.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is present.

members.name: form
members.description:
The "form owner" to associate the button with. If omitted, the closest containing form will be used instead. The
value of this attribute must be an id of a form in the same document or shadow root as the button.

members.name: formAction
members.description: Used to override the form owner's `action` attribute.

members.name: formEnctype
members.description: Used to override the form owner's `enctype` attribute.

members.name: formMethod
members.description: Used to override the form owner's `method` attribute.

members.name: formNoValidate
members.description: Used to override the form owner's `novalidate` attribute.

members.name: formTarget
members.description: Used to override the form owner's `target` attribute.

members.name: click
members.description: Simulates a click on the button.

members.name: focus
members.description: Sets focus on the button.

members.name: blur
members.description: Removes focus from the button.

members.name: validationTarget
members.description: Override this to change where constraint validation popups are anchored.

members.name: setCustomValidity
members.description:
Do not use this when creating a "Validator". This is intended for end users of components.
We track manually defined custom errors so we don't clear them on accident in our validators.

members.name: formStateRestoreCallback
members.description:
Called when the browser is trying to restore elements state to state in which case reason is "restore", or when
the browser is trying to fulfill autofill on behalf of user in which case reason is "autocomplete". In the case of
"restore", state is a string, File, or FormData object previously set as the second argument to setFormValue.

members.name: resetValidity
members.description: Reset validity is a way of removing manual custom errors and native validation.

members.name: styles
members.description:
Override the default styles property to fetch and convert string CSS files. Components can override this behavior
by setting their own `static styles = []` property.

members.name: customStates
members.default: { /** Adds or removes the specified custom state. */ set: (customState: string, active: boolean) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return; if (active) { this.internals.states.add(customState); } else { this.internals.states.delete(customState); } }, /** Determines whether or not the element currently has the specified state. */ has: (customState: string) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return false; return this.internals.states.has(customState); }, }
members.description: Methods for setting and checking custom states.

members.name: relayNativeEvent
members.description:
Given a native event, this function cancels it and dispatches it again from the host element using the desired
event options.

members.name: css
members.description:

this instead of Lit's styles property because we're importing CSS files as strings and need to convert them using

members.name: validators
members.description:
Validators are static because they have `observedAttributes`, essentially attributes to "watch"
for changes. Whenever these attributes change, we want to be notified and update the validator.

members.name: validationTarget
members.description: Override this to change where constraint validation popups are anchored.

members.name: value
members.description:
The current value of the color picker. The value's format will vary based the `format` attribute. To get the value
in a specific format, use the `getFormattedValue()` method. The value is submitted as a name/value pair with form
data.

members.name: defaultValue
members.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

members.name: label
members.description:
The color picker's label. This will not be displayed, but it will be announced by assistive devices. If you need to
display HTML, you can use the `label` slot` instead.

members.name: hint
members.description: The color picker's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

members.name: format
members.description:
The format to use. If opacity is enabled, these will translate to HEXA, RGBA, HSLA, and HSVA respectively. The color
picker will accept user input in any format (including CSS color names) and convert it to the desired format.

members.name: size
members.description: Determines the size of the color picker's trigger

members.name: withoutFormatToggle
members.description: Removes the button that lets users toggle between format.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form control, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the color picker.

members.name: open
members.description:
Indicates whether or not the popup is open. You can toggle this attribute to show and hide the popup, or you
can use the `show()` and `hide()` methods and this attribute will reflect the popup's open state.

members.name: opacity
members.description: Shows the opacity slider. Enabling this will cause the formatted value to be HEXA, RGBA, or HSLA.

members.name: uppercase
members.description: By default, values are lowercase. With this attribute, values will be uppercase instead.

members.name: swatches
members.description:
One or more predefined color swatches to display as presets in the color picker. Can include any format the color
picker can parse, including HEX(A), RGB(A), HSL(A), HSV(A), and CSS color names. Each color must be separated by a
semicolon (`;`). Alternatively, you can pass an array of color values to this property using JavaScript.

members.name: form
members.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

members.name: required
members.description: Makes the color picker a required field.

members.name: getHexString
members.description: Generates a hex string from HSV values. Hue must be 0-360. All other arguments must be 0-100.

members.name: focus
members.description: Sets focus on the color picker.

members.name: blur
members.description: Removes focus from the color picker.

members.name: getFormattedValue
members.description: Returns the current value as a string in the specified format.

members.name: reportValidity
members.description: Checks for validity and shows the browser's validation message if the control is invalid.

members.name: show
members.description: Shows the color picker panel.

members.name: hide
members.description: Hides the color picker panel

members.name: setCustomValidity
members.description:
Do not use this when creating a "Validator". This is intended for end users of components.
We track manually defined custom errors so we don't clear them on accident in our validators.

Exposes the internal modal utility that controls focus trapping. To temporarily disable focus trapping and allow third-party modals spawned from an active Shoelace modal, call `modal.activateExternal()` when the third-party modal opens. Upon closing, call `modal.deactivateExternal()` to restore Shoelace's focus trapping.

members.name: validators
members.description:
Validators are static because they have `observedAttributes`, essentially attributes to "watch"
for changes. Whenever these attributes change, we want to be notified and update the validator.

members.name: type
members.description:
The type of input. Works the same as a native `<input>` element, but only a subset of types are supported. Defaults
to `text`.

members.name: value
members.description: The current value of the input, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: defaultValue
members.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

members.name: size
members.description: The input's size.

members.name: appearance
members.description: The input's visual appearance.

members.name: pill
members.description: Draws a pill-style input with rounded edges.

members.name: label
members.description: The input's label. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

members.name: hint
members.description: The input's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

members.name: withClear
members.description: Adds a clear button when the input is not empty.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Placeholder text to show as a hint when the input is empty.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Makes the input readonly.

members.name: passwordToggle
members.description: Adds a button to toggle the password's visibility. Only applies to password types.

members.name: passwordVisible
members.description: Determines whether or not the password is currently visible. Only applies to password input types.

members.name: withoutSpinButtons
members.description: Hides the browser's built-in increment/decrement spin buttons for number inputs.

members.name: form
members.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

members.name: required
members.description: Makes the input a required field.

members.name: pattern
members.description: A regular expression pattern to validate input against.

members.name: minlength
members.description: The minimum length of input that will be considered valid.

members.name: maxlength
members.description: The maximum length of input that will be considered valid.

members.name: min
members.description: The input's minimum value. Only applies to date and number input types.

members.name: max
members.description: The input's maximum value. Only applies to date and number input types.

members.name: step
members.description:
Specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to, or the special value `any` which means no stepping is
implied, allowing any numeric value. Only applies to date and number input types.

members.name: autocapitalize
members.description: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered by the user.

members.name: autocorrect
members.description: Indicates whether the browser's autocorrect feature is on or off.

members.name: autocomplete
members.description:
Specifies what permission the browser has to provide assistance in filling out form field values. Refer to
[this page on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for available values.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: Indicates that the input should receive focus on page load.

members.name: enterkeyhint
members.description: Used to customize the label or icon of the Enter key on virtual keyboards.

members.name: spellcheck
members.description: Enables spell checking on the input.

members.name: inputmode
members.description:
Tells the browser what type of data will be entered by the user, allowing it to display the appropriate virtual
keyboard on supportive devices.

members.name: withLabel
members.description: Used for SSR. Will determine if the SSRed component will have the label slot rendered on initial paint.

members.name: withHint
members.description: Used for SSR. Will determine if the SSRed component will have the hint slot rendered on initial paint.

members.name: focus
members.description: Sets focus on the input.

members.name: blur
members.description: Removes focus from the input.

members.name: select
members.description: Selects all the text in the input.

members.name: setSelectionRange
members.description: Sets the start and end positions of the text selection (0-based).

members.name: setRangeText
members.description: Replaces a range of text with a new string.

members.name: showPicker
members.description: Displays the browser picker for an input element (only works if the browser supports it for the input type).

members.name: stepUp
members.description: Increments the value of a numeric input type by the value of the step attribute.

members.name: stepDown
members.description: Decrements the value of a numeric input type by the value of the step attribute.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the input, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the form control.

members.name: validationTarget
members.description: Override this to change where constraint validation popups are anchored.

members.name: setCustomValidity
members.description:
Do not use this when creating a "Validator". This is intended for end users of components.
We track manually defined custom errors so we don't clear them on accident in our validators.

members.name: formStateRestoreCallback
members.description:
Called when the browser is trying to restore elements state to state in which case reason is "restore", or when
the browser is trying to fulfill autofill on behalf of user in which case reason is "autocomplete". In the case of
"restore", state is a string, File, or FormData object previously set as the second argument to setFormValue.

members.name: resetValidity
members.description: Reset validity is a way of removing manual custom errors and native validation.

members.name: css
members.description:
One or more CSS files to include in the component's shadow root. Host styles are automatically prepended. We use
this instead of Lit's styles property because we're importing CSS files as strings and need to convert them using
unsafeCSS.

members.name: view
members.description:
The view is a reflection of the "mobileBreakpoint", when the page is larger than the `mobile-breakpoint` (768px by
default), it is considered to be a "desktop" view. The view is merely a way to distinguish when to show/hide the
navigation. You can use additional media queries to make other adjustments to content as necessary.
The default is "desktop" because the "mobile navigation drawer" isn't accessible via SSR due to drawer requiring JS.

members.name: navOpen
members.description: Whether or not the navigation drawer is open. Note, the navigation drawer is only "open" on mobile views.

members.name: mobileBreakpoint
members.description:
At what page width to hide the "navigation" slot and collapse into a hamburger button.
Accepts both numbers (interpreted as px) and CSS lengths (e.g. `50em`), which are resolved based on the root element.

members.name: navigationPlacement
members.description: Where to place the navigation when in the mobile viewport.

members.name: disableNavigationToggle
members.description:
Determines whether or not to hide the default hamburger button.
This will automatically flip to "true" if you add an element with `data-toggle-nav` anywhere in the element light DOM.
Generally this will be set for you and you don't need to do anything, unless you're using SSR, in which case you should set this manually for initial page loads.

members.name: pageResizeObserver
members.default: new ResizeObserver(entries => { for (const entry of entries) { if (entry.contentBoxSize) { const contentBoxSize = entry.borderBoxSize[0]; const pageWidth = contentBoxSize.inlineSize; const oldView = this.view; if (pageWidth >= toPx(this.mobileBreakpoint)) { this.view = 'desktop'; } else { this.view = 'mobile'; } this.requestUpdate('view', oldView); } } })

The element the popup will be anchored to. If the anchor lives outside of the popup, you can use the `anchor` attribute or property instead.

members.name: css
members.description:
One or more CSS files to include in the component's shadow root. Host styles are automatically prepended. We use
this instead of Lit's styles property because we're importing CSS files as strings and need to convert them using
unsafeCSS.

members.name: popup
members.description: A reference to the internal popup container. Useful for animating and styling the popup with JavaScript.

members.name: anchor
members.description:
The element the popup will be anchored to. If the anchor lives outside of the popup, you can provide the anchor
element `id`, a DOM element reference, or a `VirtualElement`. If the anchor lives inside the popup, use the
`anchor` slot instead.

members.name: active
members.description:
Activates the positioning logic and shows the popup. When this attribute is removed, the positioning logic is torn
down and the popup will be hidden.

members.name: placement
members.description:
The preferred placement of the popup. Note that the actual placement will vary as configured to keep the
panel inside of the viewport.

members.name: boundary
members.description: The bounding box to use for flipping, shifting, and auto-sizing.

members.name: distance
members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its anchor.

members.name: skidding
members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its anchor.

members.name: arrow
members.description:
Attaches an arrow to the popup. The arrow's size and color can be customized using the `--arrow-size` and
`--arrow-color` custom properties. For additional customizations, you can also target the arrow using
`::part(arrow)` in your stylesheet.

members.name: arrowPlacement
members.description:
The placement of the arrow. The default is `anchor`, which will align the arrow as close to the center of the
anchor as possible, considering available space and `arrow-padding`. A value of `start`, `end`, or `center` will
align the arrow to the start, end, or center of the popover instead.

members.name: arrowPadding
members.description:
The amount of padding between the arrow and the edges of the popup. If the popup has a border-radius, for example,
this will prevent it from overflowing the corners.

members.name: flip
members.description:
When set, placement of the popup will flip to the opposite site to keep it in view. You can use
`flipFallbackPlacements` to further configure how the fallback placement is determined.

members.name: flipFallbackPlacements
members.description:
If the preferred placement doesn't fit, popup will be tested in these fallback placements until one fits. Must be a
string of any number of placements separated by a space, e.g. "top bottom left". If no placement fits, the flip
fallback strategy will be used instead.

members.name: flipFallbackStrategy
members.description:
When neither the preferred placement nor the fallback placements fit, this value will be used to determine whether
the popup should be positioned using the best available fit based on available space or as it was initially
preferred.

members.name: flipBoundary
members.description:
The flip boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when flipping. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

members.name: flipPadding
members.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the flip behavior will occur.

members.name: shift
members.description: Moves the popup along the axis to keep it in view when clipped.

members.name: shiftBoundary
members.description:
The shift boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when shifting. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

members.name: shiftPadding
members.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the shift behavior will occur.

members.name: autoSize
members.description: When set, this will cause the popup to automatically resize itself to prevent it from overflowing.

members.name: sync
members.description: Syncs the popup's width or height to that of the anchor element.

members.name: autoSizeBoundary
members.description:
The auto-size boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when resizing. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

members.name: autoSizePadding
members.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the auto-size behavior will occur.

members.name: hoverBridge
members.description:
When a gap exists between the anchor and the popup element, this option will add a "hover bridge" that fills the
gap using an invisible element. This makes listening for events such as `mouseenter` and `mouseleave` more sane
because the pointer never technically leaves the element. The hover bridge will only be drawn when the popover is
active.

members.name: reposition
members.description: Forces the popup to recalculate and reposition itself.

members.name: styles
members.description:
Override the default styles property to fetch and convert string CSS files. Components can override this behavior
by setting their own `static styles = []` property.

members.name: customStates
members.default: { /** Adds or removes the specified custom state. */ set: (customState: string, active: boolean) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return; if (active) { this.internals.states.add(customState); } else { this.internals.states.delete(customState); } }, /** Determines whether or not the element currently has the specified state. */ has: (customState: string) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return false; return this.internals.states.has(customState); }, }

members.name: validators
members.description:
Validators are static because they have `observedAttributes`, essentially attributes to "watch"
for changes. Whenever these attributes change, we want to be notified and update the validator.

members.name: validationTarget
members.description: Where to anchor native constraint validation

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the select, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: value
members.description: The select's value. This will be a string for single select or an array for multi-select.

members.name: size
members.description: The select's size.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Placeholder text to show as a hint when the select is empty.

members.name: multiple
members.description: Allows more than one option to be selected.

members.name: maxOptionsVisible
members.description:
The maximum number of selected options to show when `multiple` is true. After the maximum, "+n" will be shown to
indicate the number of additional items that are selected. Set to 0 to remove the limit.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the select control.

members.name: withClear
members.description: Adds a clear button when the select is not empty.

members.name: open
members.description:
Indicates whether or not the select is open. You can toggle this attribute to show and hide the menu, or you can
use the `show()` and `hide()` methods and this attribute will reflect the select's open state.

members.name: appearance
members.description: The select's visual appearance.

members.name: pill
members.description: Draws a pill-style select with rounded edges.

members.name: label
members.description: The select's label. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

members.name: placement
members.description:
The preferred placement of the select's menu. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the listbox
inside of the viewport.

members.name: hint
members.description: The select's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

members.name: withLabel
members.description: Used for SSR purposes when a label is slotted in. Will show the label on first render.

members.name: withHint
members.description: Used for SSR purposes when hint is slotted in. Will show the hint on first render.

members.name: form
members.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

members.name: required
members.description: The select's required attribute.

members.name: getTag

type.text: (option: WaOption, index: number) => TemplateResult | string | HTMLElement

members.description:
A function that customizes the tags to be rendered when multiple=true. The first argument is the option, the second
is the current tag's index.  The function should return either a Lit TemplateResult or a string containing trusted
HTML of the symbol to render at the specified value.

members.name: hide
members.description: Hides the listbox.

members.description: Sets focus on the control.

members.name: blur
members.description: Removes focus from the control.

members.name: setCustomValidity
members.description:
Do not use this when creating a "Validator". This is intended for end users of components.
We track manually defined custom errors so we don't clear them on accident in our validators.

members.name: formStateRestoreCallback
members.description:
Called when the browser is trying to restore elements state to state in which case reason is "restore", or when
the browser is trying to fulfill autofill on behalf of user in which case reason is "autocomplete". In the case of
"restore", state is a string, File, or FormData object previously set as the second argument to setFormValue.

members.description:
A custom formatting function to apply to the value. This will be shown in the tooltip and announced by screen
readers. Must be set with JavaScript. Property only.

members.description: Given a value, returns its percentage within a range of min/max.

members.description: Sets focus to the slider.

members.name: blur
members.description: Removes focus from the slider.

members.name: stepDown
members.description:
Decreases the slider's value by `step`. This is a programmatic change, so `input` and `change` events will not be
emitted when this is called.

members.name: stepUp
members.description:
Increases the slider's value by `step`. This is a programmatic change, so `input` and `change` events will not be
emitted when this is called.

members.name: validators
members.description:
Validators are static because they have `observedAttributes`, essentially attributes to "watch"
for changes. Whenever these attributes change, we want to be notified and update the validator.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the textarea, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: value
members.description: The current value of the input, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: defaultValue
members.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

members.name: size
members.description: The textarea's size.

members.name: appearance
members.description: The textarea's visual appearance.

members.name: label
members.description: The textarea's label. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

members.name: hint
members.description: The textarea's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Placeholder text to show as a hint when the input is empty.

members.name: rows
members.description: The number of rows to display by default.

members.name: resize
members.description: Controls how the textarea can be resized.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the textarea.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Makes the textarea readonly.

members.name: form
members.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

members.name: required
members.description: Makes the textarea a required field.

members.name: minlength
members.description: The minimum length of input that will be considered valid.

members.name: maxlength
members.description: The maximum length of input that will be considered valid.

members.name: autocapitalize
members.description: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered by the user.

members.name: autocorrect
members.description: Indicates whether the browser's autocorrect feature is on or off.

members.name: autocomplete
members.description:
Specifies what permission the browser has to provide assistance in filling out form field values. Refer to
[this page on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for available values.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: Indicates that the input should receive focus on page load.

members.name: enterkeyhint
members.description: Used to customize the label or icon of the Enter key on virtual keyboards.

members.name: spellcheck
members.description: Enables spell checking on the textarea.

members.name: inputmode
members.description:
Tells the browser what type of data will be entered by the user, allowing it to display the appropriate virtual
keyboard on supportive devices.

members.name: withLabel
members.description: Used for SSR. If you're slotting in a `label` element, make sure to set this to `true`.

members.name: withHint
members.description: Used for SSR. If you're slotting in a `hint` element, make sure to set this to `true`.

members.name: styles

Override the default styles property to fetch and convert string CSS files. Components can override this behavior
by setting their own `static styles = []` property.

members.name: customStates
members.default: { /** Adds or removes the specified custom state. */ set: (customState: string, active: boolean) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return; if (active) { this.internals.states.add(customState); } else { this.internals.states.delete(customState); } }, /** Determines whether or not the element currently has the specified state. */ has: (customState: string) => { if (!Boolean(this.internals?.states)) return false; return this.internals.states.has(customState); }, }
members.description: Methods for setting and checking custom states.

members.name: relayNativeEvent
members.description:
Given a native event, this function cancels it and dispatches it again from the host element using the desired
event options.

declarations.name: queryByTestId

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: A parent element of the DOM element to find

parameters.name: testId
parameters.description: The value of the `data-testid` attribute of the component to find.

declarations.description:
Allows you to find a DOM element based on the value of its `data-testid` attribute.
This attribute can be used to decouple identifying dom elements for testing from
styling (which is typically done via class selectors) or other ids which serve
different purposes.
See also https://kentcdodds.com/blog/making-your-ui-tests-resilient-to-change
Inspired by https://testing-library.com/docs/queries/bytestid/

declarations.name: isElementVisibleFromOverflow
declarations.description:
Given a parent element featuring `overflow: hidden` and a child element inside the parent, this
function determines whether the child will be visible taking only the overflow of the parent into account
Id does NOT check whether it is hidden or overlapped by another element
It basically checks whether the bounding rects of the parent and the child overlap

declarations.description:

declarations.name: CustomErrorValidator
declarations.description:
This validator is for if you have an exact copy of your element in the shadow DOM. Rather than needing
custom translations and error messages, you can simply rely on the element "formControl" in your shadow dom.
